description.en: At the beginning of the course the science of genetics and basic features of cellular reproduction will be introduced. The next part of the course deals with concepts of classical genetics such as the basic principles of inheritance, extensions of Mendelism, it's chromosomal basis, variation in chromosome number and structure, and linkage, crossing over and chromosome mapping in eukaryotes, the concept of quantitative genetics. Additionally, basic molecular mechanisms of maintenance and realization of genetic information will be introduced. Basic techniques of molecular genetics,  regulation of gene expression in prokaryotes and eukaryotes, and applications of molecular genetics. The course also briefly introduces human genetics, inheritance of complex traits, behavioural genetics. Finally, the concepts of population and evolutionary genetics are introduced.
description.et: Kursuse esimestes osades selgitatakse geneetika põhimõisteid ja rakkude jagunemise põhiprintsiipe. Järgnevas osas pühendutakse klassikalise geneetika seaduspärasuste tundmaõppimisele (tunnuste pärandumise põhiprintsiibid, mendelism ja mendelismi kromosoomne alus, kromosoomide arv ja muutumised, kromosoomide molekulaarne ehitus, geenide aheldatus, kvantitatiivsete tunnuste pärandumine). Kursuse teises pooles käsitletakse molekulaargeneetikat ja genoomikat. Käsitletakse geeniregulatsiooni pro- ja eukarüootidel, molekulaargeneetika meetodeid. Kursuse lõpposas käsitletakse inimesegeneetikat, komplekstunnuste avaldumist, käitumisgeneetikat. Kursuse lõpposadena käsitletakse populatsiooniogeneetikat ja evolutsioonilist geneetikat.

objectives.en: The main goal is to introduce the students to the main concepts and processes of genetics, to develop key principles of classical genetics and core concepts of molecular genetics. The course covers some aspects of human genetics, genomics, the inheritance of complex traits as well as population genetics and evolutionary genetics. In lectures, thematic problems and tasks will be solved.
objectives.et: Eesmärk on tutvustada üliõpilastele geneetika aluspõhimõtteid ning põhiprotsesse ja nende rakendamist geenitehnoloogias. Loengukursuses antakse ülevaade geneetika põhitõdedest, klassikalisest geneetikast, molekulaargeneetikast. Puudutatakse ka inimesegeneetikat, genoomikat, komplekstunnuste pärandumist, populatsiooni ning evolutsioonigeneetikat. Loengutes lahendatakse probleeme ja mõtlemisülesandeid.

learning_outcomes.en: After the course, the students are expected to
* Understand, know and apply the core principles of Classical Genetics;
learning_outcomes.et: * Mõista ning selgitada klassikalise geneetika põhimõtteid;

learning_outcomes.en: * Understand the principles and processes of Molecular Genetics, incl. the processes of synthesis of genetic material, distribution and placement in the cells, expression of genetic material;
learning_outcomes.et: * Mõista ning selgitada molekulaargeneetika protsesse, sh geneetilise materjali sünteesi, jagunemist rakkude vahel, geenide avaldumist;

learning_outcomes.en: * Knowledgeably use the terminology of genetics, incl. with the help of explanatory dictionaries;
learning_outcomes.et: * Kasutada geneetika valdkonnale spetsiifilist terminoloogiat, sh oskama leida vajalikke mõisteid geneetika sõnastikest;

learning_outcomes.en: * Use the acquired knowledge and skills in various disciplines;
* Apply the obtained knowledge in explaining daily processes, solving everyday questions.

description.et:
Introduction to the course of general genetics.  
The science of genetics.  Problem-solving skills of lecture.Prof. Ain Heinaru

Cellular reproduction. 
Cell cycle.  Chromosomes and chromatids.  Mitosis and meiosis. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Prof. Ain Heinaru

Mendelism. Extensions of mendelism
Mono-and dihybrid crosses. Testing genetic hypothesis. Pedigrees. Allelic variations. Gene function. Phenotype and genotype. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Prof. Ain Heinaru

Chromosomes
Chromosome number. Sex chromosomes. Segregation and independent assortment.  Problem-solving skills of lecture. Prof. Ain Heinaru

Variation in chromosome number and structure.
Karyotype. Polyploidy. Aneuploidy. Chromosome structure. Translocations. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Prof. Ain Heinaru

Gene linkage and chrossing over.
Linkage, crossing over and chromosome mapping.  Recombination frequency. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Prof. Ain Heinaru

Complex traits
Quantitative genetics. Statistical genetics. Correlations between relatives. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Prof. Ain Heinaru

Population genetics.
Allele frequencies. Natural selection. Random genetic drift. Genetic equilibrium. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Prof. Ain Heinaru

Evolutionary genetics.
Genetic variation in natural populations. Molecular evolution. Speciation, Human evolution Problem-solving skills of lecture. Prof. Ain Heinaru
Test (Lectures 1-9) prof Ain Heinaru

The genetics of bacteria and their viruses.
Genetic exchange in bacteria. Genetic of bacterial viruses. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Ass.Prof. Andres Mäe

DNA and RNA structure.
The double helix. Negative supercoiling. Chromosome structure. . Problem-solving skills of lecture. Ass.Prof. Andres Mäe

Replication of DNA and chromosomes.
Replication forks. Bidirectional replication. Polymerases. The primosome and the replisome. Replication of chromosomes. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Ass.Prof. Andres Mäe

Transcription and RNA processing.
Transcription in prokaryptes and eukaryotes. Operon. Gene splicing. RNA editing. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Ass.Prof. Andres Mäe

Translation and the genetic code
Protein synthesis. Properties of genetic code. Codon-anticodon pairing. Codon-tRNA interactions. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Ass.Prof. Andres Mäe

Mutation, DNA repair, and recombination.
Mutation types.  DNA repair mechanisms. DNA recombination mechanisms. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Ass.Prof. Andres Mäe

Gene cloning.
Restrictases and the gene mapping. Vector molecules. Recombinant DNA. GMOs. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Ass.Prof. Andres Mäe

Transposable genetic elements
Transposition types. Transposable elements in bacteria, eukaryotes and huimans. Retroposons and retroviruses. Problem-solving skills of lecture. Ass.Prof. Andres Mäe
Test (Lectures 10-20), ass. prof Andres Mäe
Exam
Re-examination
